docs.snippet: The Giants keep their fan-favorite receiver Victor Cruz in the fold with a five-year contract extension worth $43 million....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Giants keep their fan-favorite receiver Victor Cruz in the fold with a five-year contract extension worth $43 million.
docs.abstract: New York Giants sign receiver Victor Cruz to a 5-year, $43 million contract extension that will tie him to the team until at least the 2018 NFL season.

headline.main: Cruz Remaining With Giants; Contract Is Extended Until 2018
headline.print_headline:
Giants Sign Cruz to Deal
Through 2018 Season

docs.snippet: The federal judge overseeing the case said she would not rule on the N.F.L.’s motion to dismiss until Sept. 3 to give the mediator time to bring the sides closer....
docs.lead_paragraph: The federal judge overseeing the case said she would not rule on the N.F.L.’s motion to dismiss until Sept. 3 to give the mediator time to bring the sides closer.
docs.abstract: Federal Judge Anita B Brody delays ruling in NFL concussion case and brings in a mediator to bring sides closer.

headline.main: Judge Orders N.F.L. Concussion Case to Mediation
headline.print_headline: Judge Delays Ruling in N.F.L. Concussion Case and Brings In Mediator

byline.contributor: Jon Hurdle contributed reporting from Philadelphia.

docs.lead_paragraph: The New England Patriots owner Robert Kraft made public comments for the first time since the team’s former tight end Aaron Hernandez was charged with murder.
docs.abstract: New England Patriots owner Robert K Kraft makes public comments for the first time since the team's former tight end Aaron Hernandez was charged with murder; suggests the team was duped if allegations are true; other football news noted.

docs.snippet: The big business of college sports may change because of a pending lawsuit, which was brought because of video games like EA’s NCAA Football, the newest version of which comes out on Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: The big business of college sports may change because of a pending lawsuit, which was brought because of video games like EA’s NCAA Football, the newest version of which comes out on Tuesday.
docs.abstract: Chris Suellentrop article notes big business of college sports may change due to pending lawsuit over whether athletes deserve to be paid for use of their likenesses in video games, like newest version of Electronic Art's NCAA Football 14.

headline.seo: Even NCAA College Football 14 Is Changing
headline.main: New Season of Hard Hits (Maybe in Court)

docs.snippet: The suit, brought by 19 former students at Yeshiva University High School for Boys, in Manhattan, names Rabbi George Finkelstein, a former principal, and Rabbi Macy Gordon, a former teacher....
docs.lead_paragraph: The suit, brought by 19 former students at Yeshiva University High School for Boys, in Manhattan, names Rabbi George Finkelstein, a former principal, and Rabbi Macy Gordon, a former teacher.
docs.abstract: Lawyer for 19 former students at Yeshiva University High School for Boys files a federal lawsuit, claiming that two former rabbis there carried out hundreds of acts of sexual abuse during the 1970s and 1980s, and that the university’s leaders covered it up.

headline.main: Lawsuit Says 2 Rabbis Abused Boys at Jewish High School
headline.print_headline: Lawsuit Says 2 Rabbis Abused Boys at Jewish High School
